channel.title: Current State of Kloak?
channel.description: I'm interested in installing the keystroke anonymization tool Kloak in Dom0 of Qubes OS. @Patrick mentioned that the upstream is dead, so how will that affect Whonix and Qubes using it? Will plans to include it be scrapped?

item.title: Current State of Kloak?
item.dc:creator: qua3k
item.description:
This will be solved with the addition of libsodium.

Read full topic

item.title: Current State of Kloak?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
github.com/vmonaco/kloak

Clarification on intended behavior of random()

opened 09:45PM - 21 Aug 21 UTC
qua3k

Hello, I noticed that you use the `random()` function but it does not appear to …be explicitly seeded and will use a seed of `1`. I am asking for clarification on whether this is intended behavior. Additionally, I hope you are aware that `random()` is not suitable for generating secure random numbers.

Read full topic

item.title: Current State of Kloak?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Device Fingerprinting with Peripheral Timestamps / Mouse Fingerprinting Development
Mouse Fingerprinting Author of Keystroke Anonymization Tool Kloak is working on a Mouse Anonymization Tool, see: Test website: https://vmonaco.github.io/device-fingerprinting/ Test website source code: Related: kloak - Keystroke Anonymization Tool Current State of Kloak?

item.title: Current State of Kloak?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
github.com/vmonaco/kloak

compilation warning string_fortified.h:106:10: warning: '__builtin_strncpy' specified bound

opened 07:56PM - 04 Aug 21 UTC
adrelanos

``` gcc src/main.c src/keycodes.c -o kloak -lm -lpthread -Wdate-time -D_FORTIFY…_SOURCE=2 -g -O2 -ffile-prefix-map=/build/kloak-0.2.29=. -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security -Wl,-z,relro -Wl,-z,now gcc src/eventcap.c -o eventcap -Wdate-time -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -g -O2 -ffile-prefix-map=/build/kloak-0.2.29=. -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security -Wl,-z,relro -Wl,-z,now In file included from /usr/include/string.h:495, from src/main.c:2: In function 'strncpy', inlined from 'main' at src/main.c:554:5: /usr/include/x86_64-linux-gnu/bits/string_fortified.h:106:10: warning: '__builtin_strncpy' specified bound depends on the length of the source argument [-Wstringop-overflow=] 106 | return __builtin___strncpy_chk (__dest, __src, __len, __bos (__dest)); | ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ src/main.c: In function 'main': src/main.c:554:5: note: length computed here 554 | strncpy(_rescue_keys_str, rescue_keys_str, strlen(rescue_keys_str)); | ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ```

Read full topic

item.title: Current State of Kloak?
item.dc:creator: madaidan
item.description:
Patrick:

kloak has already capability sys_ptrace, Therefore should be allowed already?

No, the capability and apparmor ptrace rules are different.

Patrick:

This fixed it:

That should be changed to ptrace readby,. Giving it all ptrace permissions is dangerous. It only needs readby.

Read full topic

item.title: Current State of Kloak?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
This fixed it:

github.com/Whonix/kloak

apparmor allow ptrace

committed 05:30PM - 13 Jan 20 UTC
adrelanos
+3 -0 
https://forums.whonix.org/t/current-state-of-kloak/5605/19

Read full topic

item.title: Current State of Kloak?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
This does not happen directly after boot. Only when manually run whonixcheck form terminal after boot.

kloak has already capability sys_ptrace, Therefore should be allowed already?

madaidan:

Kloak shouldn’t need to ptrace whonixcheck.

We need to understand why this happens. If it has a strange interaction with whonixcheck it might have a strange interaction with other applications too.

madaidan:

Add

deny ptrace,

In worst case this could crash kloak or render it ineffective.

Read full topic

item.title: Current State of Kloak?
item.dc:creator: madaidan
item.description:
Add

deny ptrace,

to the kloak profile. Kloak shouldn’t need to ptrace whonixcheck. Dunno why it’s giving errors.

Read full topic

item.title: Current State of Kloak?
item.dc:creator: madaidan
item.description:
Patrick_mobile:

All already enabled.

They don’t seem to be for me on Arch Linux.

hardening-check gives me

kloak:
 Position Independent Executable: yes
 Stack protected: yes
 Fortify Source functions: no, not found!
 Read-only relocations: yes
 Immediate binding: no, not found!

checksec gives me

RELRO           STACK CANARY      NX            PIE             RPATH      RUNPATH	Symbols		FORTIFY	Fortified	Fortifiable  FILE
Partial RELRO   Canary found      NX enabled    PIE enabled     No RPATH   No RUNPATH   140 Symbols     Yes	0		6	kloak

They are all fully enabled on Whonix though. It may be a difference in Debian and Arch’s default toolchain. It would probably be helpful to hard code the hardening flags in so it doesn’t rely on the OS’s toolchain having them by default.

The default compiler for kloak (GCC) also doesn’t seem to support things like control flow integrity or safestack which those scripts don’t check for either.

Read full topic

item.title: Current State of Kloak?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
This could be reviewed for example by using:

hardening-check

and

checksec --file

Read full topic

item.title: Current State of Kloak?
item.dc:creator: Patrick_mobile
item.description:
All already enabled.

Read full topic

item.title: Current State of Kloak?
item.dc:creator: madaidan
item.description:
I wonder if it would make sense to enable compile time hardening flags for kloak. I don’t know very much about these so I’m not sure.

Read full topic

item.title: Current State of Kloak?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
No idea. Reported upstream.

github.com/vmonaco/kloak

Issue: Apparmor profile signals to kill kloak by systemd

opened by adrelanos on 2019-09-18 
Qutoe @madaidan https://forums.whonix.org/t/current-state-of-kloak/5605/10
In the logs, I'm now getting errors about kloak's AppArmor. The profile needs these lines
signal receive set=cont peer=unconfined,
signal receive...

Read full topic

item.title: Current State of Kloak?
item.dc:creator: madaidan
item.description:
In the logs, I’m now getting errors about kloak’s AppArmor. The profile needs these lines

signal receive set=cont peer=unconfined,
signal receive set=exists peer=unconfined,
signal receive set=kill peer=unconfined,
signal receive set=term peer=unconfined,

Although, it’s weird. I think this is because systemd sends those signals to kloak to kill it but then why wouldn’t we need these for other AppArmor profiles?

Read full topic
